simpleName: RF Transmitter and an RF Receiver
productDetails: 433 MHz module is a wireless transmitter/receiver that allows communication between Arduino boards and other devices, such as sensors.
A servo for Arduino is a motor controller that allows precise control and positioning of a servo motor in Arduino projects.
A servo tester for Arduino is a device used to test and calibrate servo motors, allowing for precise control and positioning.
ESP CAM for Arduino is a camera module based on the ESP32 chip that provides wireless connectivity and can be easily integrated with Arduino projects.
ESP32 for Arduino is a microcontroller based on the ESP32 chip that provides Wi-Fi and Bluetooth connectivity and is commonly used in IoT projects.
ESP8266 for Arduino is a low-cost Wi-Fi microchip that can be easily programmed with the Arduino IDE for IoT projects.
The KK2 board is a flight controller board used for quadcopter and other multirotor projects that can be programmed using the Arduino IDE.
CC3D board is a flight controller board used for quadcopter and other multirotor projects that can be programmed using the Arduino IDE.
A battery tester for Arduino is a device that measures the voltage and current of a battery to determine its capacity and health.
A heart rate sensor for Arduino is a device used to measure heart rate and pulse rate for health monitoring and fitness applications.
Joysticks 2 for Arduino are input devices that provide two analog axes to control motion or direction in Arduino projects.
RFID (Radio Frequency Identification) sensors use electromagnetic fields to identify and track tags and cards. Arduino can read and write data from them.
A big LiPo (Lithium Polymer) battery can power an Arduino for extended periods, providing high energy density and rechargeability.
A small LiPo (Lithium Polymer) battery can power an Arduino for short periods, providing portability and rechargeability. It requires voltage regulation.
HC-05 is a Bluetooth module that enables wireless communication between an Arduino and other devices, such as smartphones or laptops.
Buck and boost converters are used with Arduino to step down or step up DC voltages, respectively, for efficient power management.

productName: Power distribution board for bread board
productDetails: A power distribution board for breadboard Arduino provides regulated power supply to multiple components on a breadboard, simplifying prototyping.
DHT22 is a digital temperature and humidity sensor that can be used with Arduino to measure ambient temperature and humidity levels.
DHT11 is a low-cost digital temperature and humidity sensor that can be used with Arduino for basic temperature and humidity measurements.
Soil moisture sensors can be used with Arduino to measure the moisture content of soil and determine when plants need watering.
A PIR (Passive Infrared) sensor can be used with Arduino to detect motion in a room or other space.
Relay modules can be used with Arduino to switch high-voltage AC or DC devices, such as lights or motors, using low-voltage signals.
An LCD (Liquid Crystal Display) can be used with Arduino to display text, graphics, and other data in a range of sizes and resolutions.
A 220V AC to Arduino power supply can convert AC voltage to DC voltage suitable for powering an Arduino microcontroller.
A solar panel can be used with Arduino to generate power from sunlight, providing a sustainable and portable power source.

productName: Li ion cells and batteries 6 to 7
productDetails: Li-ion (Lithium-ion) cells and batteries can be used with Arduino to provide compact, high-capacity, and rechargeable power for portable projects.
Arduino Uno is a popular microcontroller board based on the ATmega328P processor, with digital and analog inputs and outputs.
ESP8266 NodeMCU is a microcontroller board with built-in WiFi, used with Arduino to create IoT projects and connect to the internet.
ESP32-CAM is a microcontroller board with built-in WiFi and camera, used with Arduino to create IoT projects with image and video capabilities.
A medium-sized breadboard can be used with Arduino for prototyping circuits and testing components, without the need for soldering.
A large breadboard can be used with Arduino for prototyping more complex circuits and testing multiple components simultaneously, without soldering.
DC motors can be used with Arduino to convert electrical energy into mechanical energy, enabling control of speed and direction.

simpleName: car chasis with 2 motors and 3 tyres
productDetails: A car full set, or rover complete set, with Arduino typically includes a chassis, wheels, motors, sensors, and other components for building a mobile robot.
Battery holder for 2 batteries is a device that provides power to an Arduino board using 2 batteries as a power source.
OV7670 is a popular camera module for Arduino with a resolution of 640x480 and can capture both images and videos.

simpleName: To connect motors with arduino and control them
productDetails: L293 is a popular motor driver IC used with Arduino to control DC and stepper motors with up to 36V and 600mA.
LM25965 is a DC-DC step-down converter used to power Arduino projects by efficiently converting higher voltage to 5V or 3.3V.

simpleName: To connect motors with arduino and control them
productDetails: L298 H-bridge is a DC motor driver used with Arduino to control the speed and direction of two DC motors.
LEDs (Light Emitting Diodes) are commonly used with Arduino boards to display output or as indicators. Code controls LED behavior.
The 9V battery connector on an Arduino board provides power to the board through a barrel jack or Vin pin.
Jumper wires are used to connect components on a breadboard to an Arduino board, allowing for prototyping and experimentation
Jumper wires are used to connect components on a breadboard to an Arduino board, allowing for prototyping and experimentation
Jumper wires are used to connect components on a breadboard to an Arduino board, allowing for prototyping and experimentation
A 1Kohmn resistor in an Arduino circuit can be used for current limiting, pull-up or pull-down, and voltage divider applications.
A 100Kohm resistor in an Arduino circuit can be used for current limiting, pull-up or pull-down, and voltage divider applications.
A 40Kohm resistor in an Arduino circuit can be used for current limiting, pull-up or pull-down, and voltage divider applications.
A 10Kohm resistor in an Arduino circuit can be used for current limiting, pull-up or pull-down, and voltage divider applications.

productName: FTDI USB to TTL Serial Converter
productDetails: FTDI USB to TTL Serial Converter is a popular choice to connect Arduino to a computer for programming and data exchange.
A mini water pump can be controlled using an Arduino to provide water flow for small-scale projects or experiments.
A step-down transformer reduces the voltage of an AC power source to a lower level suitable for use with an Arduino.
LDR (Light Dependent Resistor) sensor in Arduino measures light intensity and adjusts output based on surrounding illumination.
IR sensor detects infrared radiation and converts it into a digital signal that can be read by an Arduino board.
